blog.name: pikelansource

blog.description:

 header image by @toriitorii

summary: I think for today’s pikelan day I want to talk about “my arms were always around you,” the song ashley chose for scanlan in her...
body:
I think for today’s pikelan day I want to talk about “my arms were always around you,” the song ashley chose for scanlan in her end of campaign playlist

like it’s astonishing I haven’t ever done this post but at the end of the vm arc I was a little busy being in denial about it ending. but this song is really interesting from pike’s perspective.

like this is the start of the song:

  • Just say to me You’ll be the fool this time
  • You’ll take my place For a little while
  • You’ll give me a chance
  • You’ll let me break you down
  • Let me use you up, you’ll show me how

Like obviously this is someone else’s song so ymmv

But pike putting herself in the position of addressing scanlan by “you’ll be the fool this time” is a helluva reversal on the perception of the bulk of this relationship during the show. Same with “you’ll give me a chance.”

Ashley’s time on the show being so limited as well as her character being so emotionally reserved left a great deal unsaid about her feelings. Maybe once pike is starting to acknowledge her feelings for scanlan are more than she wanted them to be, he was a) rescinding his proposal and saying they just need to be friends and then b) leaving the group due to his own personal crisis based off a few false assumptions about his place in their group. And when she started missing him and then wondering if maybe he wasn’t coming back, she started regretting not realizing the depth of her affection earlier. Scanlan may have gone about it wrong and not shown his real self like he ought to have, but he was up front about his feelings for her. She wasn’t. Maybe that’s her interpretation here.

Also the “you’ll let me break you down” and “show me how” really speaks for these particular people, who are both superficially open but hide their real feelings about themselves to almost everyone. This is pike requesting more of the real deal, no matter much scanlan wants to hide it and nnnggghhhh that is my shit.

And at the heart of the song you get this:

  • Oh, my love You thought I’d left without you
  • Oh, my love My arms were always around you

I don’t think if ashley had actually been there for episode 85 we would’ve actually gotten a reaction this strong, but in hindsight after he left this was what pike was thinking about his departure and that line where he said “scanlan has no one.”

Pike was away so much she seemed to think of her being drawn away as the natural state of her relationship to everyone in Vox Machina. But i think when scanlan left pike realized a) how much space he actually took up in her thoughts, even when she was the one going away and b) that he felt as alone as she did, as separate from the group as she did. And when he came back her anger softened very quickly but it softened the most when scanlan said he’d been praying to sarenrae—bc it was proof that he took part of her with him too.

I think that’s what going on with this song choice, and her word choice in the final episode and the campaign wrap up when she said “it was always scanlan” and “there’s no one I’d rather spend the rest of my days with.”

She wants to be definitive and decisive with those words finally and say always and the rest of her life to say neither of them are capable of leaving without a piece of the other.

And I really love that’s her song for scanlan, who was defined for so long by his pining, that she’s always been thinking about him.

summary: The moment that Beau yells at Dairon about being left behind broke my heart.  This is someone who wants so badly to be needed...
body: The moment that Beau yells at Dairon about being left behind broke my heart.  This is someone who wants so badly to be needed and trusted, to be believed to be worth something.  She’s spent so long being told that she’s worthless and a piece of shit that she decided to embody it.  It’s not her natural state of being, though.  She’s intrinsically good.  She wants to be helpful and useful and just.  She’s such a study of a person trying despite all the things that have happened to her and I just… ugh.

tags: dnd podcasts we know and love
the critical zone? adventure role zone?
summary:
I love talking to my friend about our respective dnd podcasts. 
She tells me about Critical Role and the serious drama and...
body:
I love talking to my friend about our respective dnd podcasts.

She tells me about Critical Role and the serious drama and trauma and backstories and jokes and how it’s all pretty organized. I love the idea of how intricate and indepth it’s able to go bc of the sheer insane amount of time spent on it.

Meanwhile I told her the most recent villains in the live show episode were daft punk and every time we talk she can’t get over the incomprehensible idea of a “Fantasy Costco” existing or having a canon reason for every reference to real world stuff or elevators or Garfield the Deals Warlock.

Both highly enjoyable, but completely opposite energies, equally powerful.

I can’t wait til we switch and watch each other’s shows lol.
